title: Sweetcoiner
author: Sweetcoiner
content: I have been experiencing some financial difficulties due to the inflation I explained my situation to my friend about plans on how to secure my Investments since I'm already used to the character of saving but have little knowledge of bitcoin and investment in it and my friend introduced me to bitcoins and this forum I'm really glad to be here please what must I know?

comments.body: Quote from: Sweetcoiner on October 22, 2022, 08:44:27 AMI have been experiencing some financial difficulties due to the inflation I explained my situation to my friend about plans on how to secure my Investments since I'm already used to the character of saving but have little knowledge of bitcoin and investment in it and my friend introduced me to bitcoins and this forum I'm really glad to be here please what must I know?Some stickies like these;Newbies - Read before postingUnofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQAnd about bitcoin as an investment, learn to know about the basics of it like about wallets: [General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why?As you're still a newbie in the forum, avoid entertaining those unsolicited messages from unknown people that might lead you to links of phishing websites and scamming.

comments.author: Daniel91
comments.body: Quote from: Sweetcoiner on October 22, 2022, 08:44:27 AMI have been experiencing some financial difficulties due to the inflation I explained my situation to my friend about plans on how to secure my Investments since I'm already used to the character of saving but have little knowledge of bitcoin and investment in it and my friend introduced me to bitcoins and this forum I'm really glad to be here please what must I know?If you plan to invest in bitcoin, I advise you to first carefully analyze all available information and think carefully before making any investment decision.The crypto market has its own rules, it's very volatile and high risk, so if you don't know what you're doing, you can easily lose money.I advise you to only invest money that you can lose, to make an investment plan in accordance with your financial capabilities and to have a clear exit strategy.Good luck with your investment!

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: If the reason for joining the forum is purely economic reasons, it is better to wait, learn for several months, and then invest in Bitcoin, as the price may remain at these levels for the next 6 months, and therefore learning is your best weapon.With regard to investment, after learning the economic aspects, then must learn the basics of security, and if you intend to buy in large quantities, it is better to buy a hardware wallet.The details are many and cannot be listed, so start and then you can ask a question that you do not find an answer to.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: Crypto is unlikely to do well as a hedge against inflation immediately if you live in a country with fairly low levels. If you're in a country with high levels, investing in stablecoins like usdc, dai or usdt can provide good stability against the dollar but might come with some risks.I wouldn't recommend investing in bitcoin with more than you could afford to lose or going straight into a discipline like trading because you might get discouraged and just leave if the value of your investment seems to fall. Bitcoin and other cryptos are a good method for accepting payments for goods or services if you have hobbies that are marketable or can work to maintain a hedge against inflation.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Own a hardware wallet. That's my very first suggestion for anyone thinking to save cryptocurrency for the future. It's very much necessary to ensure the maximum protection of your investment and that's why you need this so that you don't get your BTC lost someday. You can try Ledger Nano, Trezor, etc but make sure you always buy this from the official store of their own. Don't buy from any third party.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: The only thing I think you should know is be careful with the choices you take on the cryptocurrency space. If you have money to invest into cryptocurrency as a newbie the market is bearish and loosing money now is at high risk. I'd advise you to think of a business to start under cryptocurrency niche. It could be a site or products and services. These are long term investment with lesser risks compared to the risk involved in buying and holding crypto especially for a person who is not used to the market fluctuations. Think and research about businesses available on the cryptocurrency niche and note those which you can handle and start with them. It takes time but, you could become another CZ In the next 3-5 years.

comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: Quote from: Sweetcoiner on October 22, 2022, 08:44:27 AMI'm really glad to be here please what must I know?Just make sure that you read the rules of Bitcointalk in order to not get banned from the forum. I believe that this forum is a good place to learn about cryptocurrency and ask anything you want. The forum is divided into various tech and non-tech categories, so there's plenty to choose from. With that said, don't be afraid to throw your own hat in the ring with a new post from time to time. It's a great way to make your voice heard on subjects you feel strongly about, and some good exchanges often develop as a result. Also, don't be afraid to ask questions, as those most often make for the best threads. There are plenty of friendly people on the forum who are more than willing to lend a hand as you navigate your way through the world of cryptocurrency for the first time. Good luck, and happy posting!
